instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-000165 - Charger green comes, Fan doesn't go on.
threads.message:
Hi, the above board has following voltages.


PBUS_G3H: 8.6V
PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL:  16.5 
pp5v_s5: 4.3V
PP3V42_G3H: 5.1V

PPVIN_G3H_P3V42G3H 16.2 
PPVIN_G3H  16.5

SMC_PM_G2_EN. Fluctuations from 0 to 3 (moving fast and difficult to read min and max using multimeter)
PPVRTC_G3H:  5.36

U7090 was replaced. Still  PP3V42_G3H value is about five. Resisters are not open in voltage divider. Any clue to go ahead?

threads.title: 820-000165 - Charger green comes, Fan doesn't go on.
threads.message:
Play with Ra/Rb.
Increasing R7096 will decrease 3V42; same effect for lower R7095.
Lower R7096 will increase 3V42; same effect increasing R7095.

threads.title: 820-000165 - Charger green comes, Fan doesn't go on.
threads.message: Is bad PP3V42_G3H is the reason for  SMC_PM_G2_EN changes?

threads.title: 820-000165 - Charger green comes, Fan doesn't go on.
threads.message: I will pull resisters and check whether they have original values.

threads.title: 820-000165 - Charger green comes, Fan doesn't go on.
threads.message: You cannot expect the SMC to work propely if gets so high power...

threads.title: 820-000165 - Charger green comes, Fan doesn't go on.
threads.message: You are right. replacing Ra and Rb solved all problems. :)
